articles.headline: New Trump Deportation Rules Allow Far More Expulsions
articles.snippet: The rules authorize expelling undocumented immigrants who have committed even minor offenses, and they make it easier to immediately deport people.
articles.abstract: The rules authorize expelling undocumented immigrants who have committed even minor offenses, and they make it easier to immediately deport people.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has directed his administration to enforce the nation’s immigration laws more aggressively, unleashing the full force of the federal government to find, arrest and deport those in the country illegally, regardless of whether they have committed serious crimes.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Ron Nixon

articles.headline: Gaza Is Outwardly Rebuilding, but Inwardly Fearful
articles.snippet: The region is uncertain as the state of play between Israelis and Palestinians shifts. It seems at a loss for what might — or even should — come next.
articles.abstract: The region is uncertain as the state of play between Israelis and Palestinians shifts. It seems at a loss for what might — or even should — come next.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIT HANOUN, Gaza Strip — In her new home, finally finished after she lived two years in a trailer across a dirt road, Samaher al-Masri, 40, showed a video on her cellphone of a cute preschooler: her son Majdi. He was singing:

articles.headline: President Trump Wants a Wall? Mexico Is It
articles.snippet: Talk of a Mexican border wall to stop illegal immigration ignores the fact that Mexico has been stopping and returning Central American migrants.
articles.abstract: Talk of a Mexican border wall to stop illegal immigration ignores the fact that Mexico has been stopping and returning Central American migrants.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just over 10 years ago, United States Border Patrol agents were startled by an unexpected new development in their rear-guard battle to stop illegal immigration: Brazilians.

articles.headline: From Trump the Nationalist, a Trail of Global Trademarks
articles.snippet: A review of foreign trademarks registered to President Trump’s companies gives clues to a globe-spanning strategy and potential conflicts of interest.
articles.abstract: A review of foreign trademarks registered to President Trump’s companies gives clues to a globe-spanning strategy and potential conflicts of interest.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Donald J. Trump has cast himself as the anti-globalist president.
articles.byline: By Danny Hakim and Sui-Lee Wee

articles.headline: 3 Generals Bound by Iraq Will Guide Trump on Security
articles.snippet: H. R. McMaster will join Jim Mattis and John F. Kelly at the table in the Situation Room, steering a new president through the crosscurrents of a stormy world.
articles.abstract: H. R. McMaster will join Jim Mattis and John F. Kelly at the table in the Situation Room, steering a new president through the crosscurrents of a stormy world.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — At one point or another, they each strode the sands of Iraq, fighting on the unforgiving battlefield of America’s costliest war since Vietnam. Now all three will sit around the table in the White House Situation Room, steering a new president through the treacherous crosscurrents of a stormy world.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: In Denmark, Brewery’s Departure Offers a Chance to Go Green
articles.snippet: Carlsberg’s decision to vacate its brewery gave Copenhagen an opportunity to regenerate a neighborhood, and meet a target to become a carbon-neutral city.
articles.abstract: Carlsberg’s decision to vacate its brewery gave Copenhagen an opportunity to regenerate a neighborhood, and meet a target to become a carbon-neutral city.
articles.lead_paragraph: COPENHAGEN — Perched in his centrally located office, Laust Joen Jakobsen looks out onto a small plaza, a rooftop basketball court and a grass bed that will be lush with flowers by the summer.

articles.headline: I Ignored Trump News for a Week. Here’s What I Learned.
articles.snippet: Coverage of President Trump may eclipse that of any single human being ever. I discovered several truths about our digital media ecosystem when I tuned it out.
articles.abstract: Coverage of President Trump may eclipse that of any single human being ever. I discovered several truths about our digital media ecosystem when I tuned it out.
articles.lead_paragraph: I spent last week ignoring President Trump. Although I am ordinarily a politics junkie, I didn’t read, watch or listen to a single story about anything having to do with our 45th president.

articles.headline: A.T.F. Filled Secret Bank Account With Millions From Shadowy Cigarette Sales
articles.snippet: An off-the-books operation, meant to finance undercover work, is the subject of a lawsuit that has been kept nearly entirely sealed for years.
articles.abstract: An off-the-books operation, meant to finance undercover work, is the subject of a lawsuit that has been kept nearly entirely sealed for years.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Working from an office suite behind a Burger King in southern Virginia, operatives used a web of shadowy cigarette sales to funnel tens of millions of dollars into a secret bank account. They weren’t known smugglers, but rather agents from the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives.

articles.headline: Trump Rescinds Rules on Bathrooms for Transgender Students
articles.snippet: The administration reversed a policy that allowed students to use the bathrooms of their choice at school, an order that caused an internal rift.
articles.abstract: The administration reversed a policy that allowed students to use the bathrooms of their choice at school, an order that caused an internal rift.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Wednesday rescinded protections for transgender students that had allowed them to use bathrooms corresponding with their gender identity, overruling his own education secretary and placing his administration firmly in the middle of the culture wars that many Republicans have tried to leave behind.
articles.byline: By Jeremy W. Peters, Jo Becker and Julie Hirschfeld Davis
